title: Michael Ballack joins forces with Frank Lampard as latest former Chelsea star to advise Blues boss
text:
Michael Ballack has become the latest of Frank Lampard's former Chelsea teammates to be called on for advice by the Blues boss.

The former Germany captain shared images of his visit to the Cobham training ground on social media - as he oversaw training and took in a meeting with Lampard and his technical adviser, Petr Cech.

Cech and the two midfielders shared the Stamford Bridge dressing room for four years, winning the 2009/10 Premier League title and reaching the Champions League final together.

Michael Ballack is the latest former Chelsea star to join forces with Lampard at Cobham

Ballack shared images of his visit, including a chat with old pals Petr Cech and Lampard

Chelsea's record goalscorer prefers to surround himself with familiar faces from his playing days in his young managerial career.

Assistant Jody Morris joined him in his summer switch from Derby to Chelsea, Petr Cech has joined from Arsenal as a technical adviser, and he signed Ashley Cole at Pride Park in the left-back's final move before retirement last season.

Ballack, who ended his playing career in 2012 at Bayer Leverkusen, is highly respected for his leadership qualities and is a popular figure around Stamford Bridge - leading many fans to call for his appointment as a coach or director of football.

The responsibilities of Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo were taken on by director Marina Granovskaia when the Nigerian quit in 2017 - but Ballack's on-field experience could benefit Chelsea in the boardroom.

description: Michael Ballack is the latest of Frank Lampard's former Chelsea teammates to be called on for advice by the Blues boss - overseeing training and meeting with Lampard and Petr Cech.
